body.p: Although is mostly intended to be a visual editing tool, the all platforms distribution of is bundled with a scripts subfolder containing scripts to automate and run various utilities from the command line. For running all these scripts you are required to purchase a special scripting commercial license. Trial scripting licenses can also be provided on demand for clients interested in testing the scripts for their workflows.

section.title: DITA Validate and Check For Completeness
section.p: The Validate and Check For Completeness action from the DITA Maps Manager view allows you to validate a DITA Map with a large array of settings. The settings dialog has an Export settings button which allows you to export the settings to an XML configuration file. Once the settings are exported you can use the scripts/validateCheckDITA script to run validation on a DITA Map and report the results in a separate XML document.

body.p: A public example of using such a script as a GitHub action for reporting errors in pull requests on DITA project can be found here: . The GitHub action calls a Gradle script target named runValidation: .

section.title: XML Schema Documentation
section.p: You can generate documentation for XML Schemas from by using the main menu Tools Generate documentation XML Schema Documentation action. The settings dialog has an Export settings button allowing the settings to be exported to an XML configuration file. Once the settings are exported you can use the scripts/schemaDocumentation.sh script to generate XML Schema documentation from the command line.

section.title: XSLT Stylesheets Documentation
section.p: You can generate documentation for XSLT Stylesheets from by using the main menu Tools Generate documentation XSLT Stylesheet Documentation action. The settings dialog has an Export settings button allowing the settings to be exported to an XML configuration file. section.title: WSDL Documentation
section.p: You can generate documentation for WSDL documents from by using the main menu Tools Generate documentation WSDL Documentation action. The settings dialog has an Export settings button allowing the settings to be exported to an XML configuration file. Once the settings are exported you can use the scripts/wsdlDocumentation.sh script to generate XML Schema documentation from the command line.

section.title: XML Instance Generator
section.p: You can generate multiple XML documents from an XML Schema from by using the main menu Tools Generate sample XML files action. The settings dialog has an Export settings button allowing the settings to be exported to an XML configuration file. Once the settings are exported you can use the scripts/xmlGenerator.sh script to generate multiple XML instance files from the command line.

section.title: Flatten XML Schema
section.p: You can flatten an XML schema containing multiple includes and redefines to a single schema file from by using the main menu Tools Flatten schema action. You can use the equivalent scripts/flattenSchema.sh script to flatten an XML schema from the command line.
